makerProjects.title: Side Projects
makerProjects.subtitle: Personal projects and experiments
makerProjects.description: I'm working on some exciting side projects that showcase my technical skills and product thinking.

caseStudies.title: Mobile Checkout Redesign
caseStudies.subtitle: Increasing conversion rates by 32% through UX optimization
caseStudies.description: Led the complete redesign of our mobile checkout flow, resulting in a 32% increase in conversion rates and $2.4M additional annual revenue.
caseStudies.imageAlt: Mobile checkout flow redesign showing before and after user interface

content.context: This project emerged from a critical need to improve our mobile experience. User analytics showed a concerning 68% cart abandonment rate on mobile devices, significantly higher than our desktop conversion rate. With mobile traffic accounting for 65% of our total visits, this represented a major revenue opportunity that we needed to address urgently.
content.problem: How might we redesign the mobile checkout experience to reduce friction and increase conversion rates while maintaining security and user trust?

process.title: Discovery & Research
process.description: User interviews, analytics analysis, competitive research

process.title: Testing & Iteration
process.description: User testing, A/B testing setup, design refinement

artifacts: User journey maps identifying friction points
Competitive analysis of 12 leading e-commerce platforms
A/B testing framework and success metrics definition
content.impactDetails: The redesigned mobile checkout experience exceeded all our success metrics. Beyond the quantitative improvements, we received overwhelmingly positive user feedback, with many customers noting the smoother, more intuitive flow. The success of this project led to its methodology being adopted across other product teams in the organization.

reflection.whatWentWell: The close collaboration between design, engineering, and data teams enabled rapid iteration and testing. Our user-centered approach ensured we solved real problems rather than assumed ones.
reflection.whatIdDoDifferently: I would have involved customer service teams earlier in the process to better understand common user support issues that could be prevented through better UX design.
reflection.keyTakeaway: Small UX improvements in critical user flows can have exponentially large business impact. The key is identifying the right leverage points through data and user research.

caseStudies.title: AI-Powered Recommendations
caseStudies.subtitle: Boosting engagement with personalized content discovery
caseStudies.description: Developed and launched an ML-powered recommendation system that increased user engagement by 45% and session time by 28%.
caseStudies.imageAlt: AI recommendation system interface showing personalized content suggestions

content.context: Our platform had a vast content library but users struggled to discover relevant content. With over 10,000 pieces of content and growing, the traditional browse-and-search approach was leading to poor content discovery and low engagement rates.
content.problem: How might we leverage machine learning to create a personalized content discovery experience that increases user engagement and session duration?

process.title: Data Analysis & Research
process.description: User behavior analysis, content taxonomy creation, ML algorithm research

process.title: Algorithm Development
process.description: Collaborative filtering implementation, content-based filtering, hybrid approach

process.title: UI/UX Design
process.description: Recommendation interface design, personalization controls, feedback mechanisms

process.title: Testing & Launch
process.description: A/B testing, performance optimization, gradual rollout

artifacts: User behavior analysis report with engagement patterns
ML algorithm comparison and selection criteria
A/B testing framework for recommendation effectiveness
Performance monitoring dashboard and alerting system
content.impactDetails: The AI-powered recommendation system transformed our content discovery experience. Users found more relevant content, leading to increased engagement and longer session times. The system continuously improved through user feedback and behavior learning.

reflection.whatWentWell: The iterative approach to ML model development allowed us to test and refine our algorithms before full deployment. Strong collaboration between ML engineers and UX designers ensured technical feasibility and user-friendly design.
reflection.whatIdDoDifferently: I would have invested more in explainability features to help users understand why certain content was recommended, which could improve trust and engagement.
reflection.keyTakeaway: Personalization requires a balance between algorithmic sophistication and user control. Giving users visibility and control over their recommendations significantly improved adoption and satisfaction.

caseStudies.title: Enterprise Analytics Dashboard
caseStudies.subtitle: Empowering data-driven decisions for enterprise customers
caseStudies.description: Built a comprehensive analytics dashboard for enterprise clients, leading to 40% faster decision-making and 90% customer satisfaction.
caseStudies.imageAlt: Enterprise analytics dashboard showing data visualization and insights

content.context: Our enterprise customers were struggling to extract meaningful insights from their data. They needed a comprehensive analytics solution that would allow them to make data-driven decisions quickly and efficiently, without requiring technical expertise.
content.problem: How might we create an intuitive, powerful analytics dashboard that empowers enterprise users to make faster, more informed business decisions?

process.title: Enterprise Research
process.description: Customer interviews, requirements gathering, competitive analysis

process.title: Architecture & Design
process.description: Data architecture design, dashboard wireframing, user flow mapping

process.title: Development & Testing
process.description: Backend development, frontend implementation, user acceptance testing

process.title: Deployment & Training
process.description: Pilot program, user training, feedback collection

artifacts: Interactive dashboard prototypes and user flows
Success metrics and KPIs tracking framework
content.impactDetails: The enterprise analytics dashboard revolutionized how our customers interacted with their data. Decision-making speed increased by 40%, and customer satisfaction reached 90%. The dashboard became a key differentiator in our enterprise sales process.

reflection.whatWentWell: Deep customer research at the beginning ensured we built exactly what enterprise users needed. The iterative feedback process during development prevented scope creep and maintained focus on core value propositions.
reflection.whatIdDoDifferently: I would have involved customer success teams earlier to better understand ongoing support needs and create more comprehensive training materials.
reflection.keyTakeaway: Enterprise products require a different approach to user research and design. The key is understanding not just what users want, but what they need to achieve their business objectives efficiently.
